Clicked - Gear icon.
Soft Yellow ≈ Toggle Music Player Settings.
Dark Blue ≈ Automatic Gain Control.
Light Green ≈ Speed Control.
Automatic Gain Control (AGC):
AGC dynamically modifies audio volume, enhancing or reducing it in real-time
based on the current loudness of the music to maintain optimal listening levels.
Speed Control:
Enables the [[[strong:Speed Control]]] UI which allows users to adjust the playback speed.
[[[strong:1.00]]] is the default speed; below this is slower and above this is faster.
Example: [[[strong:0.85]]] is 15% slower than the default speed.
This is the body where songs will be added to via:
• [[[button:Search Menu][../Search]]]
• [[[button:History][../History]]]
• [[[button:Favourites][../Favourites]]]
This button opens a UI to rate the song
Choose a number to save the rating both to the database and embed it in the song file
Click a previously selected number to remove the rating

[[[warning:NOTE]]]: The selected number will briefly turn yellow to indicate it is being saved. During this time, any additional clicks will be ignored. Once saving is complete, the number will change to the user defined colour
The volume slider starts in the middle at 1.0, which is the default volume level.
Moving the slider down decreases the volume, reaching a minimum of 0.1, which is the lowest audible level.
At 0.0, the sound is completely muted.
Sliding the slider up increases the volume, with a maximum setting of 2.0.
This higher setting amplifies quiet songs, but it risks clipping.
This is the default state.
It features a button labelled 'Seek' that opens the playback bar for further interaction.
In the Non-Refresh State, the UI includes several components:
**Close Button:** This button closes the UI and returns to the Default State.
If the user right-clicks it, the UI transitions to the Continuous Refresh State.
Additionally, clicking the Close Button and reopening the Seek will set the slider to the current playback time.
**Slider:** This slider allows users to adjust the playback position.
The time is displayed in hh:mm:ss format.
Users can also input time directly into a small box next to the slider.
The input can be in various formats:
- If only seconds are provided, it must be a number without colons.
- If minutes and seconds are provided, it must be in mm:ss format.
- If hours are included, it must be in hh:mm:ss format.
**Go Button:** This button seeks to the specific time set on the slider or in the text input.
The Continuous Refresh State mirrors the Non-Refresh State but without the Go Button.
Each adjustment to the slider is applied immediately, providing real-time feedback.
However, this mode may consume slightly more CPU resources as it refreshes the screen with each slider movement.
